summary: An FBI email chain from October 8, 2019, providing an update on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, including the status of seized digital evidence, scheduled attorney proffers for co-conspirators, victim identification, and planned victim briefings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; digital devices were seized from his Manhattan residence and from him personally at the time of his arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a co-conspirator; her attorney had a proffer scheduled for October 8, 2019.

connections.description: Maxwell is identified as a co-conspirator in the investigation of Epstein.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Attorney Proffer
events.description: An attorney proffer session for alleged co-conspirator Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled.

events.title: Attorney Proffer
events.description: An attorney proffer session was held (subject unspecified in the provided text).

events.title: Scheduled Attorney Proffer
events.description: An attorney proffer session was scheduled (subject unspecified in the provided text).

events.title: Miami Victim Briefing
events.description: A victim briefing was scheduled to be held in Miami.

events.title: Attorney Proffer Scheduled
events.description: An attorney proffer session was scheduled (subject unspecified in the provided text).

events.title: NYC Victim Briefing
events.description: A victim briefing was scheduled to be held in New York City.

keyFacts: Approximately 78 digital devices in total were seized in the investigation: 47 from Epstein's Manhattan residence, 29 from Little St. James, and 2 from Epstein's person at arrest.
Analysis of devices from the Manhattan residence and from Epstein was limited due to an ongoing taint team review.
Approximately 80 victims had been identified, with potentially dozens more unidentified.
A hotline had received 194 calls, of which 26 were related to possible victims and 10 to possible co-conspirators.
Two victim briefings were scheduled: one in Miami on October 15, 2019, and one in NYC on October 23, 2019.
